content: treble_crochet round 2 slip_stitch into space between trebles 3 chain counted as 1st treble_crochet 1 treble_crochet into same space continue around circle doing 2 treble_crochet into each space join with a slip_stitch into 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain 24 treble_crochet round 3 do 2 slip_stitch across the 2 treble_crochet into next main space to create the 6 corners & starting with the first corner do 3ch 1 treble_crochet 2ch 2 treble_crochet into this 1st space then *2tr into next space then 2tr 2ch 2tr * in next space for the next corner repeat from * to * and finish round join with a slip_stitch into 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain round 4 slip_stitch across 2 treble_crochet into next main space which is a corner 3ch 1 treble_crochet 2 chain 2 treble_crochet * 2tr into next space 2tr into next space so there are 2 lots of 2 treble_crochet in these 2 spaces 2tr 2ch 2tr into next space for corner repeat from * to * and finish round join with a slip_stitch into 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain round 5 repeat as for round 4 but fill in 3 spaces in between corners round 6 repeat as for round 4 but fill in 4 spaces in between corners round 7 repeat as for round 4 but fill in 5 spaces in between corners round 8 repeat as for round 4 but fill in 6 spaces in between corners round 9 repeat as for round 4 but fill in 7 spaces in between corners joining the hexies - read all instructions first using the contrast yarn double_crochet the hexies together on the outside start with laying down the main centre front one then place 5 hexies around this main one so they are touching note do not put one on the top edge of main one double_crochet around the 5 sides of the main hexie joining in one hexie on each side when doing the double_crochet make sure you put the hook through both front & back loop of the edges 4 loops on hook work from the outside of the circle of hexies fasten_off & turn bag over fold the side hexies & bottom one in half turn bag over & you will see where the centre one will go on the back of the bag using a double_crochet repeat as for front joining the 5 hexies in a circle again once the centre hexie is joined to the other 5 you will be able to join all the other seams the same way with double_crochet don t forget the very bottom of the bag at the corners top border starting up on the high side do 2 row of double_crochet all around the top doing 2dc in the outside corners to give a sharp square look do 1 extra row of slip_stitch all around to finish off attach the pair of store-bought handles to the high edges as shown in photo © di scaysbrook 2023 fibrefest
